Abstract: Woman with AIDS and mental problems is given money to feed herself and her young son until their food stamps are reinstated; help comes from Momentum AIDS Project, beneficiary of Federation of Protestant Welfare Agencies, one of seven local charities supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund; photo (M)
Snippet: Woman with AIDS and mental problems is given money to feed herself and her young son until their food stamps are reinstated; help comes from Momentum AIDS Project, beneficiary of Federation of Protestant Welfare Agencies, one of seven local charit...
LeadParagraph: Most nights, P. J. Sanchez, 9, comes into his mother's bedroom while she is sleeping and feels her hand and forehead, checking to make sure she is still alive.

Headline.Main: A Gift of Food, and Help for Depression and AIDS
Headline.PrintHeadline: THE NEEDIEST CASES; A Gift of Food, and Help for Depression and AIDS
